text: An association between the root nodule of a leguminous plant and rhizobium sp, is known as
explanation:
The association between the root nodule of a leguminous plant and rhizobium sp is a symbiotic relationship that benefits both the plant and the bacteria.
Rhizobium bacteria aresoil bacteria that infect the roots of leguminous plants and cause the formation of nitrogen-fixing nodules. The bacteria convert atmospheric nitrogen into ammonia, which the plant can use for growth and development.Leguminous plantson the other hand with their plant roots provide food to the rhizobia in the form of carbohydrates, such as malate and succinate.
Mycorrhiza is a symbiotic relationship between the roots of plants and fungi that benefits both organisms.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Amphibians are normally found

options.B: in water and on moist land

explanation:
Amphibians are mostly semi-aquatic and spend part of their time on land and part in water. They typically start out as larvae living in water, but some species have developed behavioural adaptations to bypass this.
Amphibians require moist habitats, and relative humidities of about 80% work well for most species. Hence, they live in water as well as a moist land. OptionB
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Viviparity occurs mainly in the
explanation:
Among animals, viviparity is development of the embryo inside the body of the parent, eventually leading to live birth, as opposed to reproduction by laying eggs that complete their incubation outside the parental body. This is found mainly in mammals.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The jointed structure in insects that bears organs which are sensitive to touch, smell and vibration is the
explanation:
The Antennae are sensory organs that are made up of one or more jointed segments and are attached to the first one or two segments of the insect's head.
Insects have paired antennae so they can smell in stereo. The jointed structure in insects that bears organs sensitive to touch, smell, and vibration is the antennae
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of following groups is the most advanced?
explanation:
Pteridophytes don't have seeds. They propagate by spores. ·Gymnosperms are the earliest seed plants.Gymnosperms have advanced reproductive structurescompared to pteridophytes. Gymnosperms produce seeds as well. Gymnosperms are the most advanced. OptionDis the correct answer
Thallophyta- body not differentiated into roots and stem,no vascular system,no seed formation
Bryophyta- body differentiated but lack vascular system,no seed formation
Pteridophyta- well- differentiated body, vascular system present, no seeds formation
Gymnosperms- well-differentiated body with vascular system, seeds are naked(not enclosed in a fruit)
Angiosperms- well-differentiated body with vascular system, seeds are covered(enclosed in a fruit)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Most monocots are easily recognized by their
explanation:
Many monocot leaves are sword-shaped. Monocot leaves are typically narrow and elongated, with parallel veins that run from the base of the leaf to its tip.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Water fleas, wood lice and barnacles belong to the group?
explanation:
Crabs, prawns, lobsters, barnacles, wood lice and water fleas belong to the class Crustaceans as aquatic free living animals
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The mode of feeding in Amoeba and Hydra is
explanation:
Amoeba and hydra are bothheterotrophs, meaning they consume organic material and smaller organisms.
Holophytic nutrition is the same as autotrophic nutrition. Both terms refer to the process by which organisms create their own food using inorganic materials, such as water, carbon dioxide, and mineral salts, in the presence of sunlight.
Symbiotic nutrition is a type of interaction between two organisms where they share shelter and nourishment, and both benefit from the relationship.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following organisms does not exist as a single free living cell?
explanation:
Mold is a multicellular fungus.Mold is a living organism that grows in a network of hyphae called a mycelium. The mycelium is the visible part of mold. Mold reproduces by releasing spores into the air, which can then settle in a new area.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The center for learning and memory in the human brain is the
explanation:
Medulla oblongatais the bottom-most part of your brain.Its location means it's where your brain and spinal cord connect, making it a key conduit for nerve signals to and from your body. It also helpscontrolvital processes like yourheartbeat, breathing and blood pressure.
Thecerebellum coordinates and regulates muscle tone, balance, and posture. The cerebellum plays a role in higher-order functions, including cognitive, emotional, and reward processes.
TheCerebrum is the largest part of the brain,making up about 80% of it. It'sresponsible for memory, intelligence, emotions, personality, and more.It is the center for intelligence, memory, and emotions. It coordinates voluntary muscle movements and helps in maintaining posture and balance.
Theolfactory lobe's main function is to transmit the sense of smell.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Urea formation occurs in the
explanation:
The functions of the heart areto pump blood and oxygen around the body and deliver waste products (carbon dioxide) back to the lungs to be removed.
Urea is produced in the liver:
Production: The liver produces urea through a series of biochemical reactions called the urea cycle. The urea cycle converts ammonia, a toxic waste product from the breakdown of amino acids, into urea, which is nontoxic and water-soluble.Transport: Urea is dissolved into the blood and transported to the kidneys.Excretion: The kidneys excrete urea in urine along with water and other waste products.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The structure that holds the yolk in position is labelled
explanation:
I - Albumin
II - Shell
III - Chalaza
IV - Germinal disc
Thechalazaeare a pair of spring-like structures that project from the equatorial region of the vitelline membrane into the albumen and are considered to act as balancers, maintaining the yolk in a steady position in the laid egg.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The part labelled IV is the
explanation:
Germinal disc as seen in the diagram
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The gas produced during tissue respiration can be identified by using
explanation:
Carbon dioxide (CO\(_2\) is the gas produced during tissue respiration. And it can be identified by bringing it close to lime water ( Calcium hydroxide), which turns the lime water solution milky.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A seedling grown in the dark is likely to be
explanation:
A seedling grown in the dark will eventually die because it won't have enough energy or food to grow. Seedlings grown in the dark grow taller than seedlings grown in the light, but without much leaf development. This is because they use stored chemical energy in their cells to grow. They become etiolated(pale and drawn out due to a lack of light).
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The enzyme invertase will hydrolyze sucrose to give
explanation:
Sucrose is a dissacharide that resulted from reaction of 1 molecule of Glucose and 1molecule of fructose.However, Sucrose can be split into Glucose and fructose in the presence of an enzyme, invertase.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: When yeast respire anaerobically, it converts simple sugar to carbon (IV) oxide and
explanation:
When yeast breaks down sugar through anaerobic respiration, it producesethanol, carbon dioxide, and energy. This process is also known as fermentation.
Yeast uses anaerobic respiration when oxygen is not available. This type of respiration is important economically because it's used to make foods like bread and alcoholic drinks.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The transportation of oxygen and carbon (IV) oxide in mammals is carried out by
explanation:
White blood cellsare also calledleukocytes.They protect you against illness and disease. Think of white blood cells as your immunity cells.
Platelets, or thrombocytes,are small, colourless cell fragments in our blood that form clots and stop or prevent bleeding. Platelets are made in our bone marrow, the sponge-like tissue inside our bones.
Phagocytesare a type of white blood cell (leukocyte) that are part of the immune system's defense mechanism.
Red blood cells(RBCs) transport oxygen from the lungs to the body's tissues. RBCs contain hemoglobin, a protein that binds to oxygen. The Red blood cells are also referred to aserythrocytes.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The veins of the leaf are formed by the
explanation:
The veins of a leaf are formed by thevascular tissuewithin the leaf, which branches out from the midrib to form a network structure.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The parts which function together to bring about hearing are labelled
explanation:
The parts of the ear that enable hearing are the outer ear, middle ear, and inner ear, and the auditory nerve:
Outer ear: Sound waves enter the ear through the ear canal and hit the eardrum.Middle ear: The eardrum vibrates and sends vibrations to the malleus, incus, and stapes, three tiny bones that amplify the sound vibrations.Inner ear: The vibrations are sent to the cochlea, a snail-shaped organ that contains fluid and hair cells. The vibrations cause the fluid to ripple, which moves the hair cells. The hair cells bend, which opens pore-like channels that send an electrical signal to the brain via the auditory nerve. The brain interprets the electrical signal as sound.Auditory nerve: Carries the electrical signal from the inner ear to the brain.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The part labelled II is the
explanation:
Ear ossicles - Stapes, incus and Malleus
(See diagram above)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: When specimen X is mixed with few drops of iodine solution, the appearance of a blue-black colour confirms that X is
explanation:
The iodine test is a chemical reaction that detects the presence of starch by turning a solution or food blue-black. Speximen X contains starch
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The structure above represents a
explanation:
Cervical vertebrae (See diagram above)
The cervical vertebrae are located in the neck, or cervical spine, which is the first seven vertebrae of the spine.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Blood vessel usually pass through the structure labelled
explanation:
The transverse foramina are small holes in the vertebrae that allow the vertebral arteries, veins, and sympathetic nerves to pass through. The vertebral arteries supply blood to the brainstem and cerebellum by entering the foramen magnum. (labelledVin the diagram). OptionC
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Salts and water are absorbed in the roots and transported to leaves by
explanation:
The water and salts are absorbed by the root hair and undergo cell to cell movement byosmosisuntil they reach the xylem. This water is then transported through thexylem vesselsto the leaves and is evaporated by the process of transpiration.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The number of plants species obtained from a population study of a garden is as follows: Guinea grass (15), Ipomea spp (5), sida spp (7) and Imperata spp (23). What is the percentage of occurrence of Imperata spp?
explanation:
Total number of species = 15 + 5 + 7 + 23 = 50
Total number of Imperata spp = 23
Percentage occurence of Imperata spp = number of imperata/ total number of species X 100
= \(\frac{23}{50}\)\(\times 100\)
= 46% - OptionC
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Carbon (IV) oxide content of the atmosphere is least affected by

options.A: cutting down and clearing of forests

explanation:
Apart from cutting down and clearing of forests, in the other options,Carbon (IV) oxide content of the atmosphere is greatly affected.
When forests are cut down or burned, the stored carbon is released into the atmosphere as CO\(_2\).
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The factor that least affects food shortages in sub-saharan Africa is
explanation:
Food production in Sub-Saharan Africa (SSA) is affected by a number of factors, including climate change, the need for increased investment, and the need for structural change to the farming system. Mixed-cropping least affects food shortages because Mixed cropping, or mixed crop-livestock farming, is a dominant agricultural model in sub-Saharan Africa. some of the reasons are due to:
Environmental and social concerns: Mixed farming is promoted to address environmental and social concerns.
Food security: Mixed crop-livestock systems are important for the food security of poor people in developing countries.
Risk minimization: Farmers use mixed cropping to minimize losses due to rainfall variability and pest.
Sub-Saharan Africa (SSA) experiences heavy flooding, and the frequency and intensity of these events is increasing.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The epiphytic habitat can best be described as
explanation:
The epiphytic habitat is a moist, tropical environment where epiphytic plants grow on other plants for support, and access nutrients and sunlight:
Epiphytes are found in tropical and temperate regions, and are often found in dense, shaded forests- where we have many trees (Arboreal)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The highest percentage of energy in an ecosystem occurs at the level of the
explanation:
Producers have the highest percentage of energy in an ecosystem. Producers, such as plants, are at the base of the food chain and have the most energy. They use energy from the sun to create organic sugar.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The greatest influence on a stable ecosystem in nature is exerted by
explanation:
Humans, animals, and rainfall all have an impact on the stability of an ecosystem, but humans have the greatest influence. Humans have a pervasive influence on all ecosystems on Earth, and many are directly dominated by humans. Some of the influence are negative and they include pollution, deforestation, burning fossil fuels, Agriculture, habitat loss, over-harvesting etc
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The physical space occupied by an organism together with its functional role in community can be described as
explanation:
An organism's niche is the role it plays in an ecosystem, including the conditions it needs to survive and reproduce, and its interactions with other organisms.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A freshwater pond may contain

options.A: tadpole, water boatman, leeches and crab
options.B: water beetle, shrimps, water snail and water bug
options.C: water lily, fish, water scorpion and dragon larva
options.D: pon skater, water lily, shark and mosquito larva

explanation:
Many organisms live in freshwater ponds, includingInsects(dragon fly), frogs, fresh water snails, bacteria, daphnia, water lily, fishes etc
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The hygrometer is used for measuring
explanation:
A hygrometer is a device that measures the humidity, or amount of water vapor, in the air
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The distribution of plants in a rain forest is governed mainly by
explanation:
Several factors govern the distribution of plants in a rainforest, including temperature and rainfall
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Both recessive and dominant characters are found

options.A: on different chromosomes in the cell
options.B: at the same locus of a homologous chromosome
options.C: at different loci of a homologous chromosome
options.D: on the same chromatid in a chromosome

explanation:
Both recessive and dominant characters can be found at the same locus of a homologous chromosome. Chromosomes in a homologous pair have the same genes in the same order, but they may have different alleles. OptionBis the correct answer
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The probability of a baby being a boy or a girl depends on the contribution of the
explanation:
The probability of a baby being a boy or a girl depends on the father's sex cells because sperm cells can have either an X or a Y chromosome, while eggs always have an X chromosome.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following statements is true of blood groups and blood transfusion?

options.A: Group O is the universal recipient
options.B: Group A can donate to group A only
options.C: Group AB is the universal recipient
options.D: Group B can donate to group B only

explanation:
Blood Group O is the universal donor while Group AB is the universal recepient. A and B can donate to AB. OptionCis the correct answer.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following is likely to encourage inbreeding in plants?
explanation:
Monoecious plants encourage inbreeding more than dioecious plants because monoecious plants have both male and female flowers on the same plant, while dioecious plants have separate male and female plants
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A tall plants crossed with a dwarf one produces offspring of which half are tall and half are dwarf. What are the genotypes of the parents?
explanation:
The parents' genotypes are:
Heterozygous Tall ( Tt ) and Homozygous for  Dwarfism ( tt )
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In man, the ability to roll the tongue is a variation classified as
explanation:
Physiological variation is when members of the same species react to their environment differently. Here are some examples of physiological variation in humans and animals. E.g People have different abilities to taste phenylthiocarbamide (PTC), roll their tongues, and have different blood types.
Morphological variation is the difference in the structure and form of organisms, which can occur within or between species. It can be caused by genetic factors, environmental factors, or a combination of both. Some examples of morphological variation include: Hair colour, hair quantity, extra body parts, and missing body parts in humans.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Darwin is considered the first scientist who correctly explained the theory of
explanation:
Special creation -Louis Pasteur
Spontaneous generation -Aristotle
Use and disuse -Jean Baptiste Lamarck
Charles Darwinis known as the first scientist to propose the theory of evolution by natural selection.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The stem of a typical aquatic plant usually has many
explanation:
Aquatic plants have largeair cavitiesin their stems, leaves, and roots, which are called aerenchyma. Aerenchyma is a spongy tissue that creates air channels and gaps in the plant. These air cavities help the plant float and provide buoyancy.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The role of the male adult honey bee is to
explanation:
The main role of a male honey bee, also known as a drone, is to mate with the queen bee in order to fertilize new queens.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The ability of an organism to live successfully in an environment is known as
explanation:
Adaptation is a heritable trait that helps an organism survive and reproduce in its environment. Adaptations can be behavioral, morphological, or physiological. They can be the result of a gene mutation that improves an organism's ability to survive and reproduce. Over time, the mutation becomes more common as it passes to offspring.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The most important adaptation of xerophytes is the ability of the protoplasm to

options.A: resist being damaged by loss of water
options.B: store sugar and minerals in the vacuoles

explanation:
Xerophytes are plants that have adapted to survive in dry environments, such as deserts, salt marshes, and saline soils. The most adaptation is to resist being damaged by loss of water
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A green snake in green grass is able to escape notice from predators because of its
explanation:
Disruptive coloration is a camouflage technique that uses contrasting patterns to break up an animal's outline and make it harder to see.
Countershading is a type of camouflage where an animal's upper body is darker than its underside.
Warning coloration is a defense mechanism used by animals to warn predators that they are toxic, distasteful, or have other harmful qualities.
Cryptic colouration, also known as camouflage, is a defense mechanism that helps organisms hide their identity, location, and movement by blending in with their surroundings. It's a common form of visual camouflage that uses color patterns to make it harder for predators to see the organism.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: For heterotrophic organisms, competition is least caused by the inadequacy of
explanation:
Among autotrophs, Light is the major cause of competition because they need sunlight to manufacture their food and survive unlike heterotrophs. Hence,competition is least caused by inadequacy of light.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.
